case.state: God, God! This is where in the world ... I do not know what is it?

Wait, I'm going to play strip poker against a CAR?!? What kind of whacky world did I stumble into this time?
O...kay, I guess I'm playing strip poker with a talking vase. I've done weirder things, I guess.
A... toilet. One of my opponents is a literal toilet. This is a weird world...
God, God! This is where in the world ... I do not know what is it?
Oh, hello there! What is this place, some sort of... crossover world?

case.state: ... not true? I thought I was not going to spend the weekend but everything ... At least for me.
I think it's easy to play poker on the weekends.
I quit the game, you think it will take a long time, right?
I... guess I'm not the first Supernova to come here?
It's not like I knew I was gonna be in a hot spring...
Wait, we're being broadcast across the world? ...Actually, if it's just this world, it's fine. Is your streaming service interdimensional?
Oh wow, I'm in some sort of livestream? What's that about? Is it interdimensionally available?
Whoa! That's a WHOLE lot of cosmic energy... in the shape of a person? What IS that, Jolyne?
Oh. You. I've heard about you, Chara.
So you're the one. Chara, wasn't it?
We meet again, Chara. I did beat you, in the end. Well, another me, but you get my point.
Oh, are you here too, Chara? You were finally defeated by another version of me, right?
Umm... hello... do I know you?
Well, to be fair, I'm pretty hard to out-special.
To be fair, I'm a lot more special than most.
Huh, playing strip poker with a butterfly. Somehow not the strangest thing I've done this week.
Huh? A winged light? Are you... coming through a portal wings-first or something? Or are you some sort of light-creature?
Hang on just a second! I know you! You're Bi, aren't you?
I know you, Bi! Don't even try to deny it! I'd recognize those arms anywhere!
I... don't think my world has a name, Lucy. I'm the only one there who even knows there's more than one.
I might be a psychic user, or something similar... I don't really know how my powers work myself.
Oh hey, looks like I was already here. What's up, other-me?
Oh, hey, look, it's the evil version of me. The one person I didn't want to deal with today.
...You. Isn't it enough to fight me normally? Do you have to bother me on my time off, too?

state.text: So you chose to go by... what the elves call us? You are me, right?

case.state: Hang on, did I just crash someone's slumber party? I'm sorry, everyone!
...Strip poker? Not how I thought I'd spend my weekend, but all things considered, it's... pretty normal. For me, at least.
I never thought I'd spend my weekend doing something as... normal as strip poker.
So this is the Inventory... I know places where multiple dimensions can converge are very few, but why does one of these have to be a strip poker club?
A place where dimensions collide... And it's a strip poker club. At least it looks like I'll blend in just fine...
The Inventory... A place for dimensions to collide and... Play strip poker? At least I'll get to relax, instead of worrying about saving all worlds again...
Those statues... Did these creatures roam this dimension at some point? Because I know a dimension where they're alive and very grumpy...
Those bottles behind the bar look interesting... I don't want to get drunk and lose control of my powers, but one drink couldn't hurt, right?
This beach is gorgeous, and the sun isn't scorching hot like in other dimensions! I'm guessing the water is at an ideal swimming temperature too...
If there's one thing most dimensions have in common, it's how beautiful their beaches are. Especially during the nighttime, where you can gaze at the starlit skies...
I don't suppose anyone needs a lifeguard here, right? I hope you all know how to swim...
Are we playing strip poker in a classroom? Is this dimension one of those where all the students say they're highschoolers, but they're actually adults in their thirties?
Strip Poker at the... Classroom? Is this one of those dimensions where the children are all properly educated on sex matters and just ignore it until they're of age?
This is quite a nice view, and I don't think anyone can see what we're doing from down there.
I always liked high places. It's amazing how much you can see, and I can instantly go anywhere I see someone in trouble.
It's a good thing that fence is there. If anyone fell, I could probably open a portal and save them, but it would ruin the mood of the game...
A pool? I forgot to bring my swimsuit... Unless people normally swim naked in this dimension? Is that a thing here?
Let's just hope we don't get the cards or our clothes wet. We still have to wear them after the game.
Is the lifeguard on a break? I don't see them anywhere... Well, I just hope nobody falls into the pool...
Maybe instead of stripping naked, we could strip to our underwear and relax in the hot springs?
There's a dimension where people inhale poison and smoke all day, and then at the end of the day they all go to the hot springs to purify themselves with clean air and sweat out the toxins.
Good thing this is strip poker, it's too hot and humid here to be dressed like this...
A hot spring! Just what I needed to relax after a day of hard work!
Are all houses here this big? Or is it one of those where some people have all the wealth and power and others have none?
This seems like a very cozy place. Whose house is this? We're not trespassing here, right?
The couch doesn't seem to be big enough for all of us. You can sit on it, I'll just get a pillow for myself...
... Did I step into the Christmas Dimension again? Or is this dimension's version of Christmas around this time of the year?
This place is so warm, despite the blizzard outside... I feel like I could just fall asleep on that couch...
Those are a lot of presents under the tree! It looks like you people have been nice this year.
I don't know whose room this is, but I like their sense of style!
I hope I don't blend in too much with the background... Well, at least until I strip out of this outfit...
Those designs on the wallpaper look like a monster I fought once... It's a bit disturbing, but I'll get over it.
So is it normal for people to strip naked in front of crowds in this dimension? Oh well...
The people in this dimension sure look... Well, different...
Are those people over there okay? They seem to be very into our game... They're also not moving very much...
Is it just me or are those lockers quite... big? Do people need that much locker space in this dimension?
... That's not a person in that locker, right? It's gotta be my imagination...
Some of those lockers are not properly locked... I hope nobody steals whatever's inside them.
I'm really liking the view from up here. This is a very clean office, do any of you work here?
So this is how offices look in this dimension... If I'm being honest, they look very similar in most dimensions.
So many books. I wish I had the time to read them all. You'd be surprised how many stories and knowledge is shared between dimensions.
Let's keep quiet, shall we? This is a library after all.
... Wait, I forgot! I borrowed a book from one dimension and left it in another! I need to get it back after this...
Are we sure we want to play here? Isn't there a cleaner place to play?
This place stinks. I mean, I've been in dimensions that stunk worse than this, but I don't usually spend my free time there...
This place reminds me of where I grew up. Umm... before I was a superhero.
Are those ghosts real? Are ghosts small and common in this dimension?
There's no need to be scared. If anything comes out of the woods, I'll protect you.
Does that house up there belong to any of you? They're not going to watch us strip naked from up there, right?
This is quite the mood for a strip poker game, are we playing on this dimension's Valentine's Day?
Mind if I ask where we are, exactly? All I see are those walls with hearts... But no doors, or windows, or even furniture...
Hearts symbolize love and affection in this dimension, right? They don't mean anything nasty or weird?
... Where are we, exactly?
Did I step into a... What exactly did I step into?
... I've got no idea where I am, but I'll play along. As always.
Are we going to practice sparring? I'm always ready for more combat training!
That's an interesting symbol on the wall. Are we in the armory of some warmongering clan, or some sort of private military?
Play nice, everyone. Just because there are weapons doesn't mean we have to use them.
Sure, I'll play with you guys. Gotta find some way to pass the time, right?
You know what I'm good at, I'm, and he said: "I'm me, I'm me. There's no exchange.
And that was good. I kept it.
There is no violence in this prejudice. Enthusiastic exchange and satisfaction of each.
Everything hurts. Such.
The swap of Hampton ~cards.ifplural(iii|PV)~ ~cards.text~, I think.
Hmm... Replace ~cards.ifplural(these|this)~ ~cards.text~, please.
You know what, I'm good. No swapping.
Actually, I'm good. I'm keeping these.
There's no saving this hand. Exchange them all, please!
These are all bad. Swap all of them, please!
I'll swap out ~cards.ifplural(these|this)~ ~cards.text~, I think.
Umm... swap ~cards.ifplural(these|this)~ ~cards.text~, please.
Alas! And she won!
Reminds me of my strength, and I was so happy for the girl!
I knew all the time spent playing video games can help!
This is a good move. Either belongs to one of the worlds on the lower side?
The hands of the board, and last week, in the name of these riches, not to pronounce them!
For who is there of it of purple color, or the beings there are some of these?
So ... I guess the one you want to get off. Not here?
Perhaps the fortune of some of the death of Antoninus Z call you?
I got a good hand'm'm'm glad, but I think there are a lot of bad world ...
We expected it. Of the violet color, but not luck or going on here.
If you're lucky, that is!
Poker games I've played recently, all the time paying for it.
Yeah! I'm winning this round!
This reminds me of the time my powers got swapped with that super-lucky girl!
I knew all those hours playing video games would be useful for something!
This is a good hand, right? Or is this one of those worlds where the goal is to get the lowest possible hand?
This hand is almost as good as that one dish I couldn't pronounce the name of last week!
Is this one of those universes where purple is a lucky color or something?
So... I guess one of you will have to strip this round. You're all okay with that, right?
Maybe some of Omega's luck has stuck to me?
I know I should be glad I have a good hand, but there's probably a bunch of universes where I have a bad one...
I must be better at this than I thought. Or maybe purple is a lucky color here?
If luck is a thing here, then I have it!
Looks like all those games of poker I played with my boss on slow days are paying off.
Nothing special. We will.
I am ...
I know what I do, that when on the one side the law-givers.
However, that's not a lot ... I do not know if that is the norm.
If you don't want.
At least I have capricious .
No one in the world can win a bet.
But ignoring the existence of one possibility ...
I don't know how many versions of Multiverse Poker are there. It's hard to keep up with the different rules and combinations ...
Nothing special. Oh well.
Guess I'll have to make do with this...
Would the Professor know what to do with this hand?
This could go either way... unless this dimension has some weird rule I don't know about.
I hope this'll be enough...
I guess it could be worse...
Would the Professor know what to do with this hand?
This could go either way... unless this dimension has some weird rule I don't know about.
...Yeah, nothing remarkable about this hand.
Well, at least I got something.
I bet there's at least one universe in which I win this hand.
I can almost feel the possibilities spreading out in front of me...
You have no idea how many different versions of poker exist in the multiverse. It's hard to keep track of all the different rules and combinations...
I guess you can't win them all...
Guess I'm not winning this one. Oh well.
This reminds me of that gasoline shake I had the other day. I am not going to try food from the robot dimension ever again...
If the goal of poker in this world is to get the lowest hand possible, I'm definitely winning!
I've got a really bad feeling about this...
I'll just have to hope someone else has an even worse hand...
This hand is as bad as that gasoline shake I had the other day. I am not going to try food from the robot dimension ever again...
Poker in this world was about getting the lowest-scoring hand, right?
I guess if everyone could get a good hand all the time, getting one wouldn't be nearly as good.
Should I be worried? I feel like I should be...
There's no point in bluffing, right? I mean, nobody's betting anything...
...Well, there's probably some universe out there where I have a good hand...
I could've used a different superpower for this, like time travel instead of dimensional portals...

state.text: Don't think you'll get off easy this time, Chara. I've been warned about you.
My other self warned me about you. Don't expect an easy victory this time.

case.state: Both of you, STOP! If you want a fight, fight me. If not, then leave each other alone, PLEASE!

Look, I get that you're mad at each other and all, but stopping things like this is my FUCKING JOB!!! If you're so hell-bent on fighting each other, do it in a wrestling ring or something! Not here in the middle of a poker game!
Well, I haven't come across any demons, but I've certainly had plenty of crazy adventures! What about the time someone hypnotized the entire city using video games, or...
Well, I haven't come across any demons, but I've certainly had plenty of crazy adventures! What about the time I had to fight an evil version of myself, or...
Well, I haven't come across any demons, but I've certainly had plenty of crazy adventures! What about the time a meteorite landed with an alien girl with INSANE luck on it, or...

You asked about my job? I'm a superhero. That means I fight crime and stop people from getting hurt using my powers, to put it as broadly as possible. So yeah, breaking up fights is pretty much exactly what my job is.
Oh... Happy birthday, Meia. You... don't seem particularly happy about it yourself, though.
Okay, I won't look. Calm down.
Calm down, I'm not looking.
Umm... no. Probably not... drinks. It's people's... other stuff, probably. Which is gross. Sorry.
Uhh... I don't think that's drinks. Probably... other stuff. From people's bodies. Sorry, I know it's gross...
I'm... not sure, but if it comes to it I can always just warp us somewhere else.
I can just teleport us elsewhere if needed. There's nothing to worry about.
Probably just a different version of yourself, don't worry. I come across other Supernovas all the time!
Really? Happy birthday, Jason!
I know there was no better option... but still... I keep seeing her face in my nightmares... knowing what I was about to do...
I know the alternative would've been worse, but I still see her face in my nightmares, moments before I... ended her life...
I... honestly don't know. On one hand, there's a whole lot of places to enter this place from, but on the other hand, surely they thought of that possibility, right?
This place has a whole lot of entrances, but also, you can't be the first person to think of that, right? So... I don't know, actually.
Hang on a second, I think I've literally, actually beaten an eldritch god before! I had a lot of help, but still!
Wait just a minute! I just remembered! I've defeated an eldritch god once! With help, but still!
Well, I thought I did, once, but... I found out today that I was wrong.
I thought I defeated a god, once, but... today's events proved me wrong.
Me and Sucrose? I guess... I never really thought about that as a possibility, but... why not?
I guess I could see me and Sucrose, maybe... What would you call it, Sugarnova or something?
Nightlife? I... may want to check that out, then. Could be fun!
Even if I wanted to put on weight, I can't. Using my powers costs so much energy that I burn it all off right away!
One of the perks of having my powers is that I can't put on weight. Using my portals costs so much energy, I can't help but burn it off!
I picked up a habit of eating at restaurants after a tough fight with a villain, but that's more of a recovery thing.
I... usually go to a restaurant after defeating a tough villain, but that's more to recover from the fight.
I'm glad you're speaking normally again.
Waitress? I honestly have no idea...
Stretchy, ribbon-shaped arms... is this normal where you're from?
Some versions of me do. Am I one of those? Maybe, hehehe.
Somehow, I kind of expected something like that. A zombie, huh? So they have zombies here that aren't brainless wandering corpses. Good to know.
You know, I experienced what it's like to be famous once, when I entered a dimension with comics about me. It was fun at first, but I got really tired of everyone gaping at me after a while.
I know what it's like to be famous; a place had comics about me once. Fun at first, but I wouldn't want to do it again. Maybe sometimes.
I kinda just randomly appeared here. I don't always get to pick where my portals lead.
Now you're sounding like my brother. He's always going on about running and racing...
I... might not be qualified to answer that. My only family member I know is my brother, and he's annoying as heck!
Alright then, I'm Supernova.
No offense, but smoking stinks. Literally. If you want to destroy your own lungs it's fine, but please keep it away from me!
Telling the truth is generally better, of course, but if it really doesn't hurt anyone, it can be alright to lie. Sometimes.
Dark secrets... Too many to count, I'm afraid.
If I won a million dollars? I dunno, guess I've never thought much about it. Maybe some other me would know.
Well, one of my best friends used to be a supervillain, so no, I don't judge people on their past.
I feel like that title definitely belongs to Hypno. Robbing people of their free will, and forcing them to fight against me... Oh, if I ever get my hands on him...
Carlos Bandito, definitely. Seriously, I can't fathom why the regular police has such a hard time with him. His only power is being shouty and hitting people with his hat!
Maybe not the strongest per se, but the one I struggled the most with was Obscura. Since she has the exact same powers as me, any advantage I had went right out the window.
Geez, talk about a loaded question. Anyway, I guess... Chameleon? Does it count if she's not even visible half the time?
You've seen it all? I bet I've seen stuff you can't even imagine! How about Agatha, the crazy old cat lady with split personality commanding an army of house cats?
That's... a weird question. I guess... Dr. Frostbite, he's the only one I can come up with. Stars, what does that say about my relationship with Professor Sub-Zero...
...Wow. Preparation is good, but don't you think you're overdoing it a little? Or is poker here just really complicated?
Is this world's poker really so complicated you need to prepare that much just to play it? If so, I might be in trouble...
Thirty-seven... wow. Either you're really overdoing your preparation, or poker is a lot more complicated than I remember it.
Um, it's a kind of game that... you know what, it's kinda hard to explain. Something that exists in my world.
Does your locket give you special powers, like my necklace does? Or are you just emotionally very attached to it?
I would say "pizza", but that's only because I work at a pizza place. I honestly just like trying out different foods.
I honestly just like trying new types of food. If I had to pick one, I'd say pizza, but that's just because I work at a pizzeria.
I think... all the time, maybe? Honestly, it's difficult to tell when each dimension I visit has its own timezones.
Decks? You... do know that this is poker, right? There are no decks.
Well, I can, in fact, travel anywhere. I mostly use it to visit alternate universes, like the one we're in now.
My favorite food? I dunno... I guess anything I haven't tried before.
Well, my name literally translates to "star lights" in Latin, which is probably because I'm from Starlight City, but seems a bit too fitting considering what my portals look like.
Sometimes, when I can't sleep, I start wondering if there's a reason why I have superpowers...
I could go and check for you, Roll. Where do you live?
When I'm not visiting other worlds, I tend to play video games a lot. I have, like, 10 different video game consoles from different dimensions back home.
It's the one I'm wearing right now! It's lovely, right?
It might not count as an actual holiday here, but I always like it when CometCon is in full swing!
Of course! I never take off my Warp Key necklace, not anymore. I learned that lesson the hard way.
...Yeah. Whenever I wake up in an unfamiliar world and don't know how I got there, it's probably because I've gotten drunk again...
I'm more dressed for cold, usually. Which comes in handy since I regularly get warped to other planets that aren't as warm as this one is.
Which animal? Stars, I don't know... An octopus, maybe?
That might sound silly to you, but I've actually met spatulas capable of stealing keys, so...
My favorite flower is probably the passion flower. I like how intricate they look.
Are you alright, Mei? Do I need to go get Amber to get you out of there?
This used to happen to the Professor all the time. Don't worry, Mei. We'll get you out.
I dunno... I guess my thoughts are... a mixture of both. Images with narration by my internal monologue. Does that make sense?
It could work... I've seen million-dollar companies in other worlds that do nearly that exact thing, right down to the name.
As far as I know, I just have one. An annoying brother named Zip.
Just money, I think. Dollars, sometimes bucks. Cash, sometimes, too. I guess it also depends what currency it is.
Well, I'm no professional chef or anything, but I know enough to cook for myself. With a recipe, that is.
I wish I had brought snacks... I always get so hungry after portaling to another world...
You got someone killed... but not permanently? Is she a zombie now or something?
How do you kill someone... non-permanently? Did you turn her into a zombie or something?
I'd offer to portal you home, but I don't know where you live.
I could take you home via portal... but I do not know where your home is.
Well, I have a brother, but... I sometimes wish I didn't. Still, he's pretty much the only family I have at this point. That I know of, that is.
I have a brother. He's pretty much my only family I know of, but he can be... difficult, at times. Pretty frequently.
Not even close, I'm afraid. I work at a pizzeria. I don't think anyone has ever mistaken me for a reporter before.
A reporter? Where'd you get that idea? I make pizzas for a living!
I... don't know, actually. If you think my cooking is good enough to show on TV... I guess I can give it a try.
If you think it's good enough, I'll try, but... I don't know if it'll look good on TV. I've never done anything like that before.

condition.saying: many people living in the streets

case.state: Well, if there's anything I'd say to them, it's... don't give up. Do what you can, and never lose hope. Things will get better.
To anyone watching who's living in the streets, don't lose hope. Keep on doing whatever you can, and things will get better. Never give up.
"Of color"? I guess... Honestly, my purple hair stands out more than my skin tone in most places.
I don't really tend to think of myself as "of color". Besides, in most places it's weirder to have purple hair than to have... whatever my skin tone is.
Oh, it was... awful. Every day, I had to struggle just to survive. I've done a lot of things I'm not proud of.
Growing up on the streets was... awful. I've had to do a lot of things I'm not proud of, just to survive to the next day.
Interdimensional audience? You mean this is being broadcast across multiple dimensions? I'd better watch what I say...
Interdimensional audience? I'd better watch what I say if this really is being broadcast in multiple dimensions!
I can't exactly say I've played strip poker with many show hosts... I think you might be the only one.
I think you might be the only show host I've ever played strip poker with, so... yes, I guess?
I'm... not from the same world as you, so... no, it wasn't inspired by you. That would probably be impossible
I... don't see how that would be possible, since I'm literally from a different universe. How could it possibly be inspired by you?
Don't worry, Sayaka, you look just fine. I bet a lot of girls wish they had a body like yours!
Gwen, you're used to visiting alternate universes, right?
I don't know... I've met versions of me that are in a relationship, and even some that are married, but in general it just... happens to me. Sometimes. It never lasts long.
I... have technically been in relationships before, but I'm by no means an expert on the matter. I tend to just stumble into them, like I do with pretty much every other aspect of my life.
Well, I can only go to places I've been to before, or it's wildly unpredictable. And even then, sometimes I end up somewhere else...
My portals can be unpredictable. Sometimes I end up somewhere I didn't mean to go. It's not nearly as bad if I go to places I've been before, but still, sometimes...
Basically, it's sort of a magic battery. It stores the cosmic energy I need to create my portals.
Even if I wanted to, I... don't think that's a good idea right now. My life is too... unpredictable. Maybe if I stop being a superhero...
I think my life is too... unpredictable to have a child right now, even if I wanted to. Maybe if I ever retire from being a superhero...
Wait a minute, what?!? That is WAY too much bad stuff to ever happen to one person! How are you still sane? Or... well, sane enough to play poker, I guess.
Well, for me it's pretty obvious, isn't it? Purple is definitely the color that best reflects me.

I guess if there was a competition for how many places you've been to... Maybe running too, unless my brother is participating... Then again, I'd probably be disqualified if I used portals. Plus it wouldn't be fair.
What object I'm skilled with? Hmm... I guess the Warp Key on my necklace counts, right? I mean, I'm the only one who can control it, so...
Um... I don't know if it counts, but I always found it weird that Arkansas is pronounced "Ar-Kansas" in some universes and "Arkansaw" in others.
Well, I wouldn't know much about this version, seeing as I just got here, but...
I just sort of... ran into this place. Literally. Through a portal.
Well, I mean, I usually try to avoid actually killing people, but when I have no other choice... Geez, I don't want to remember that...
Umm... you mean kill kill someone? Like, actually dead? I usually avoid that, but... Oh man, that is a memory I'd rather forget...
My greatest fear is that one day I'll lose control of my powers, and innocent people will die because of it...
My greatest fear is that I will lose control one day, and innocent people will suffer from it...
Ramen? Sure! I was just about to ask if anyone knows a good place to eat around here!
Cartoon physics? That could be fun, but I prefer my portals, I think. Or maybe time travel, if it wasn't such a headache.
Well... you all saw me arrive, right? I went through a portal.
I portaled in. Which I didn't really need to say, since I'm sure you all saw it. Oh well.
You wanted to know about talking horses? Well... ~pony~ is right there...
Umm... this might be a bit insensitive, but ~pony~ is living proof that horses can talk here.
Wait... you work with a talking gorilla? What kind of doctor are you?
I thought you were a doctor? What kind of doctor works with a talking gorilla? Who are you?
I guess she does look very human... but still, you can't deny that ~pony~ is a horse that can talk.
Still, you can't deny ~pony~ is a talking horse... even if she does look rather human.
You... actually make a very good point. If saving that person dooms the world, they're dead anyway, so it accomplishes nothing.
Right... the one person is part of the world, too. They'd die too if the world ended. Good point.
No. It was definitely no accident. I deliberately ended her life. And I'll do it again if I have to.
Her death was no accident. Let's be clear about that. I killed her, and if I have to, I'll kill again.

state.text: Okay, so the friend I'm talking about is known as Shadow Cat. Mind you, she wasn't my friend at first.

case.state: The Earth of this... time? I'm not a time traveler, Meia. I just visit alternate realities.

Alright, I'll tell you. Where to start... Shadow Cat was, still is, in fact, a cat-burglar extraordinaire. Sort of a mix between a ninja and a master thief. There's no place she can't get into, no matter the security measures.
I guess that would explain how... Wait a minute! No it doesn't! How in the heck does involuntary time travel translate to negative socks?
Okay, but... how exactly does time traveling involuntarily lead to negative socks?
So your 'special' brownies are full of drugs. As expected. I... don't know if it's a good idea for me to have them, then.
If your 'special' brownies have even stronger drugs than regular weed brownies, I... don't know if I should take them.
Well, I'm all for trying new things... Tell you what, if you can make it so I won't accidentally warp anyone into a black hole or something, I'll try one of your brownies.
I'm all for trying new things, but... You know what, make sure I won't harm anyone if I lose control of my powers, and I'll try out your brownies. Deal?
Well, I don't know enough about your world's magic to answer that... but I feel like magic should count as a superpower.
Personally, I think magic should count as a superpower... but I don't know enough about this world's magic to be sure about that.
That's... more than I thought. But I guess my own world has had enough similarly weird things happen to it.
Okay, more things than I thought. Though now that I think about it, my own world has enough things that would qualify as "weird", too.
Let's see... there was the whole video game hypnosis thing, the lady with the cat army, two, no, three invasions by sentient foodstuff...
To be fair, the sentient food wasn't actually from my universe... but they did seem to like it there.
Technically, the sentient food wasn't from my universe... but they did make themselves at home in it.
That sounds a lot like Amber. I swear, I don't know how that girl never runs out of energy.
Sounds like Amber. She's always so excited about everything, I don't know how she never runs out of energy.
Monsters? Umm... depends if they're the "unusual but kinda cute creature" kind or the "actually trying to kill me" kind.
There's... sort of a lot of different kinds of monsters out there. I guess it depends if they're the type that tries to kill me or not.
They went to war over their portal powers? That's terrible!
They actually went to war over that? That's terrible!
Wait, HP? As in Health Points? Do you live in a video game or something?

state.text: Zip and Amber. Much as he annoys me, I must admit, they do make a cute couple.

case.state: Arash, that describes just about all of my friends. Then again, most of them are superheroes, so...
So you can read people's desires? Maybe you should tell me mine, then, because I honestly have no idea.
I honestly have no idea... Can't you just tell me what my desire is instead?

state.text: I guess both Zaman and Dez... But I kind of feel like being a thousand-year-old spirit doesn't count. I mean, they technically don't even have a body!

case.state: I'm sure they'll come back...
Oh, the stories I could tell of me and my brother Zip...
Don't worry, I'm not just going to abandon him. If I did that, he'd probably get himself into a lot of trouble again!
I don't think so, Jessie. I've seen what it does to people's lungs.
Hmm... I can't say I've come across that one, Meia. Though I have visited my fair share of ruined worlds...

Sure, but don't go telling about it to my homeworld. Let's see... When I was a little girl, I lived on the streets, and spent my days begging and pickpocketing. I'm not proud of it, but I had to survive somehow.
You think I should start telling them my purple hair is dyed?
Hahaha! You'd like that, wouldn't you?
I think it was a bit of a game for her. She'd leave a note to the police, or to a local superhero, with a riddle pointing to her next target! And she never got caught!

Then one day, she left a note at my place. I was visiting CometCon at the time, but my superhero friends found it and managed to solve the riddles. I arrived just in time to help arrest her, and that's how we first met.

I thought that was the end of it, but you can imagine my surprise when, a couple days later, I got a text message from Shadow Cat asking me and the others to come meet her on the roof of my apartment building.

Apparently, she'd broken herself out of prison, but she'd taken her cellmate along with her, some whack job calling himself Hypno. She then realized he was up to no good, and she was asking us to try and stop him. At that point, Illura just lost it.

Screaming about needing to fix her own mistakes, Illura more or less forced Shadow Cat to work together with us to stop Hypno. In the process, she realized the consequences of what she'd done and we became friends. Sort of.

I think she still steals sometimes, but only from evil people, not just whoever has the best security system. I don't really see her much these days. But yeah, that's the story of how a supervillain became one of my friends.
Oh, you have no idea. He's got super speed, and the tendency to get really drunk. I once caught him tossing around mountains of chocolate coins all over the city!
You're missing the point, Jessie! My hair is natural, but everyone refuses to believe it!
Even so, I'd much rather be safe than sorry. Besides, I need to remain physically fit to do my job as a superhero.
Yeah, I've been through some pretty interesting stuff over the years. How exactly we dealt with Hypno is a whole other story, but I think I'd better save that one for another time.
Trust me, Jessie, it was. I'm glad I don't have to live like that anymore.
Trust me, you don't want that. It was a mess. Cars were driving over it, the chocolate started melting, it got everywhere. I think to this day, the soil there is still part chocolate!

No, you don't understand. When I said a mountain, I meant an actual mountain. I still don't know where he even got so many of them. Chocolate got everywhere. The soil around there is still part chocolate to this day.
Literal noodles for arms? What a strange world I've landed in... And you do boxing matches with them?
Hang on, how do you even confuse rice balls with jelly donuts? They have, like, nothing in common!
Wait, people confuse the rice balls with jelly donuts? How? What do those two things even have in common?
Psychic-types? And people, too? Well, if it's anything like in the Pokmon games, that is basically magic, anyway. Most other types of moves, too, probably
If those psychic-types are anything like in the Pokmon games, that's basically magic. Most other types of moves, too.
Wait, Cynthia, did you just say Pokballs? So the Pokmon video games are real?
Hang on, Pokballs? Do you come from one of the Pokmon video games, Cynthia?
So in your world actual Pokmon tournaments exist, but Pokmon games... also exist? Is it like sports games? And how did they get to the other worlds?
So Pokmon video games exist within the Pokmon universe? Is it like those sports-based games? How did they get to other worlds?
That reminds me of that Arthur C. Clarke quote. "Magic's just science that we don't understand yet."
Well, to quote Arthur C. Clarke: "Magic's just science that we don't understand yet."
Maybe it's a localization thing. Wasn't Unova based on New York? No, wait, not based on, since it's real. Similar to New York, I guess. Never mind.
If Unova is based on New York, maybe it's a localization thing? Wait, no, it's not just a video game. Never mind.
...Yeah, I don't get it either. It's either the coincidence of the century or some form of interdimensional linking.
I know it sounds impossible, but other than interdimensional linking, the only other explanation I can think of is the coincidence of the century.
Umm... why would eating fries make me unable to go through a portal? If I gain some weight, I can just open it wider, right?
How exactly would I be at risk of being stuck in this dimension from eating fries? Can't I just open the portal wider if it doesn't fit?
Sounds a lot like where I come from. I'm guessing you're an interdimensional traveler too, then, Erufuda? Where are you from?
So, basically, about the same as my own world. Got it. I'm guessing you're not from here either, Erufuda? What's your world like?
Of course you can come along! The more, the merrier, right?
Sure! The more, the merrier, right? We can discover the best food of this dimension together!
I-it's not that I hate music or something, I just... don't really... do much with it...
I don't hate music, it's just that... I don't really... have... time for it, I guess?
Um... no, I'd get actual earwarmers in that case. My headphones are there for... protection.
Not for keeping warm, no, or I'd get actual earwarmers instead. It's for... protection.
Brock... Rock... Rockets... Yeah, I guess that sort of makes sense. So then, is this "Mortis"... someone who loves death?
I guess it kind of makes sense. Brock... Rock... Rockets... So this "Mortis" guy you mentioned earlier... has something to do with death?
He sounds like the type of guy who should be put in prison. And I'd love to be the one to do so.
I think I'd like to have a word with this Mortis guy. He sounds like he needs to be put in prison.
Wait a minute... If nobody dies forever in your world, how come you've still got morticians? What do they even do?
So he's a mortician... in a world where people just respawn when they die? How is that a thing? What does he even do?
I mean, sure poker is interesting, but I usually find magic a much more interesting thing to study. And you seem to know a thing or two about the way it works in this world.
No doubt poker can be interesting, but personally, I'm much more fascinated by magic. And I can already tell you're familiar with this world's version of it.
Yes and no, sort of. It drains my energy, which makes me feel a bit hungry and a bit tired and sometimes a little sick too. I pass out if I do it too much.
Kind of, but it makes me feel tired too, and sometimes a bit sick. It drains my energy, and if I use it too much I pass out.
Umm... unless I'm wrong about the nature of the multiverse, that can't happen unless it's already happened.
That's... not really something that happens. Unless it's already happened. Or the multiverse works way differently from what I know.
No, I don't have any allergies. My brother does, but I don't. Or so he says.
No, I'm not allergic to anything, unlike my brother. Or so he says.
Oh. Wow. I... didn't know you had superpowers too. And you just saved him effortlessly. You're a better superhero than I am.
You have superpowers too? And you just saved him, like it was nothing! How are you a better superhero than I am?
Well, some are more helpful than others, of course... but I can't say there's a specific one that's been especially helpful.
Some are definitely more helpful than others... but I don't think there's one world in particular.
I might have killed someone, but I'm not a murderer. I only resort to killing when I have no other options left.
I'm not a murderer, Ayano. I only kill when I have absolutely no other choice.
I... actually meant about his abilities, not that his ship got blown up. But I guess when I come with you after this game, I'll see for myself.
That's... I was actually hoping for info about his abilities. I guess I'll see when I come with you after this game.
Could be, but I've visited a lot of universes, and only ever came across one universe-ending transdimensional monster.
Maybe, but I've only ever seen one universe-ending transdimensional monster, and I've been to a lot of universes.
That's the thing. I could've just as easily opened a portal to teleport that rocket somewhere else, but I just... didn't.
The problem is, my powers would've been useful, if only I'd opened a portal for that rocket to fly through. But I didn't.
Okay, mechsuit crocodiles was not an answer I was expecting. Any more... unusual things like that?
So things like mechsuit crocodiles are a regular occurrence? What other... unusual things does this place have?
I didn't say horses could talk in my dimension. They can't. But in this place they clearly can.
Just to be clear, horses can't talk in my dimension. They clearly can talk over here, though.
Okay, but even if it's only a Strip Poker place, it's a Strip Poker place connected to hundreds of other worlds.
This might be "just" a Strip Poker place, but it's a Strip Poker place that's connected to hundreds of other dimensions.
I... can see your reasoning, but no. I know what it's like to grow up without parents. If I can't be a reliable mother, I don't want a child.
I want to be a reliable mother, if I have a child. I know what it's like to grow up without one.
One time, I went through a portal, and ended up almost being sucked into a black hole! I still get chills when I think about it...
Hmm... I think I played something like this once, but since this is a different dimension the rules might be a bit different.
Honestly, after all my travels, I find that any snack which sounds completely ridiculous is probably something I'd enjoy. I wonder if they have caramelized rainbows here...
If I knew it would work... and if I could do it without causing any permanent damage to them...
I'd try my best to comfort and reassure them, I suppose.
Y'know, somehow, flying cabbages wouldn't be the oddest vegetables I've seen this week.
Giant frogs... Believe it or not, I've been eaten by a giant tadpole before. Does that count?
I'm not surprised, Aella. Skyscrapers are... basically just really tall buildings. Like, over 50 stories tall.
Unfortunately, yes. No matter how hard I try to save the world, sometimes a world is just beyond all hope of saving.
I've seen more than a few wastelands, unfortunately. I always try my best to save the world, but sometimes... I'm just too late...
A witch's... labyrinth? Full of evil minions? Hang on, are you saying witches have mazes here?
Hang on, witches have monster-filled mazes here? That's... weird.
It may be extraordinary to you, but to me, it's just sort of a fact of life, just like you probably take it for granted that you won't suddenly wake up in a different world when you sleep.
Things that seem extraordinary to some are just facts of life for others. For example, you probably take it for granted that you will wake up in the same world you fall asleep in.
Skewed priorities aside, I don't actually mind telling you. It's just... Actually, no. I will tell you. It's the only way to put it to rest.
You... have some odd priorities in life. I don't really mind telling you about it, but... No, scratch that. I need to do this, or it'll haunt me forever.
So... you mentioned something about special brownies, earlier. Is it what I think it is?
So... those special brownies you mentioned earlier, are they... special in the way I think they are?
Making the best out of what we have is all well and good, but if I don't know `what we have', it'll be hard making the best of it.
That's all well and good, but how can I make the best of it if I don't know `what we have'?
So, what you're saying is... nobody dies forever in your world. Most worlds... don't work that way.
I know your world might be different, but in most worlds when someone dies, that's it. They don't usually come back.
Blizz... balls? Blizz as in blizzard? Is that a type of ice cream or something? I'm intrigued.
Blizz Balls sound like a type of ice cream to me, except... not. Color me intrigued.
You have to kill on a regular basis? You don't strike me as the military type...
You said you have to kill on a regular basis? You don't look like a soldier to me...
You kill... robots? I don't know if that counts...
I don't know if killing robots counts, exactly. Can they even be considered alive?
Yeah, I've noticed that too. I guess it's because of how many worlds intersect here. This really is a strange place...
Yeah, the level of technology seems to be... all over the place. I guess that comes with being a hub world.
Defeated a... god? I've beaten a couple guys who thought they were gods, but they seemed... delusional. Still... maybe one of them...
I'm... not sure, actually. I come across bad guys with a god complex fairly often, but... maybe one of them was actually telling the truth?
No, I'm pretty sure it's... somewhere in the 2020's, at least. What country is this?
1995? No, it's at least... Well, past 2020, anyway. Do you know what country we're in?
You... tamed robots? This story's getting weirder and weirder...
How did you... How is it even possible to tame a robot?
So you're not a soldier... you don't look like an assassin either... what else could you be to have to kill on a regular basis?
You don't seem like an assassin... and you're not military either... so why do you need to kill on a regular basis?
You should be careful while you're here. I know you just respawn when you die in your world, but if you die in here... I don't know if that will happen.
Be careful in here. If you die while you're here... well, let's just say I don't know if you'll respawn.
Yeah, imagine what could happen in here. All the magic and technology from all these different worlds...
Right. I'm not sure how this place works, but imagine... All technology, all magic, all in one place...
Well, I'll make sure to ask for that if I ever find myself in... Koprulu, was it? Lava-seared Mutawings. Sounds interesting
Okay, I'll take a note of that. When visiting Koprulu, ask for lava-seared Mutawings. I'm curious what it's like.
Nice try, Saki, but I'm not that gullible. You're not the Queen of Earth.
I'm not that gullible, Saki. I can tell you're not the Queen of Earth.
The best yakiniku joint in the cosmos? Then I might have to check it out after this game. Is it expensive?
If it really is the best yakiniku joint in the cosmos, I might have to check it out after this game. If it's not too expensive, that is.
I don't judge people on things they can't control. Your sister being a mute has no bearing on my judgement of her.
I'm sure your sister has no control over being a mute, so I won't judge her for it. Nor anyone else, for that matter.
Sak? I think I've heard of that... It's made from fermented rice, right?
Isn't sak that Japanese drink made of fermented rice? I think I've heard of that.
So there are no talking animals, but there are winged horses? I'll... keep that in mind.
So horses don't talk, but some do have wings? Alright then, I guess I'll keep that in mind.
I guess you do have a point. Sometimes sacrifices need to be made. Still, I hope I never get placed in such a situation again.
I guess sacrifices do need to be made, sometimes. Still, I hope I don't need to be the one to do so ever again.
Where magic still thrives? Meaning this world once had magic too? What caused it to end?
So Gensokyo has magic, but this world doesn't... anymore? Why did magic cease to exist in this world?
So this world's magic relies on people's belief? That's... unusual.
Magic that only works when people believe in it? I don't see that often.
I would be happy to accept your invitation, Lady Miko, but I have to be careful with alcoholic beverages. Too much of it could put us both in danger.
I have to be careful with alcohol, Lady Miko. I could put us both in danger if I drink too much. Otherwise I would accept your invitation without hesitation.
The problem isn't the act itself. Even if I would order someone else to do it, I'm still responsible for ending a life.
I would still know their death was my responsibility, even if I had someone else do the deed.
France? Yeah, I've been there a few times. In a few different realities. Just checking, is this the version where the Notre Dame burned down or not?
I've been to several versions of France over the years. Is this the one where the Notre Dame caught on fire a while back? Or is this another reality?
Dealing with people like that is what I do, Fate. If you give me more information, I can probably help you out.
I can probably help you out, Fate, since dealing with those kinds of people is literally what I do. I just need more information.
...No, you don't seem to have a scar on your butt. Unless it's in a place where I can't see it right now.
Unless it's in a place I can't see, you don't seem to have a scar on your butt. Mysterious or otherwise.
No, it's probably not the same professor. Unless you're also talking about Patrick Kelvin?
You got that right! I take it you're from a world where superheroes only exist in fiction?
Actually, yes! It might be hard to believe if they're only fictional where you're from, but I'm a genuine superhero!
Not at the moment, I think. There's this world-destroying entity called Z'Gord I've fought more than a few times, but I haven't seen it lately...
I don't think so, at the moment. I've fought with the world-destroying entity Z'Gord many times, but I never seem to run into it anymore...
Oh, my Warp Key? I use it to store cosmic energy. I never take it off. What does yours do?
I suppose you could call my Warp Key that. I never take it off. It stores cosmic energy. What does your necklace do?
Is it too much? I'd dial it back, but I kinda have to wear colours that stand out, or people won't know I'm a superhero.
I kinda have to wear colours that stand out, so people know I'm a superhero. Should I dial it back a bit?
It's true that horses normally don't talk, but I have already seen several sentient horses walking around in here.
Normally, I wouldn't expect them to, but I've already seen several sentient horses walking around in here, so...
Where you won the... what now? I suppose there probably is...
I suppose there probably is a world where you won the... whatever you just said.
You don't believe me, do you? I guess they don't look particularly equine... but they're there, trust me.
They don't look very equine, I guess. No wonder you don't believe me... but they're really there.
Best. Idea. Ever. I totally forgot I could just go and get some snacks! I was getting hungry for no reason!
Wait... I can just go and get snacks. Right now. I totally forgot. Best idea ever!
Wait... You're not from this world either, Ringo? I would never have guessed.
So Ringo, you're not from this world either? I couldn't tell just by looking at you, that's for sure.
From hell? No, I'm pretty sure I didn't. Maybe it was some other me.
I'm pretty sure I never opened a portal from hell, at least not long enough for anyone besides me to go through. Maybe it was some other me?
Right, that would explain the poor grammar. You were speaking Arrowtalk, not Directionspeak.
Arrowtalk? Not Directionspeak? I... guess that would explain the poor grammar.
I... know how you feel. Sometimes, after spending a whole day speaking Directionspeak, I feel like I will scream if I can't say something normal.
So... more or less the same as my own world, then. Good to know. Thank you... Wikipe-tan.
So if I'm interpreting this correctly, it's about the same as my own world. Thank you, Wikipe-tan.
Magic and superpowers exist? Usually it's one or the other. Looks like this place is more interesting than I thought!
Many worlds have either magic or superpowers, but this one has both? Looks like I landed somewhere interesting this time...
Right now? I mean, I'm hungry too, but... I'd rather not go out in public in this state of undress.
I'm hungry too, but can it wait until I'm a bit more... dressed? I might have portals, but still...
It's entirely possible I'm not even a superhero in this world. I've been to one where I was a celebrity chef instead.
I might not even be a superhero here. I've met a version of myself who'd become a famous chef instead.
Oh, I know what a horse is, I assure you. It's just that I saw some talking horses walking around here.
Of course I know what a horse is! Believe me, I was surprised too when I saw a couple of them talking here.
Wrap myself in an... exploding egg? No, I don't think so. Why?
Why would I wrap myself in... exploding eggs? Is that what you said?
I... guess? To be honest, I'm not really sure who you are... or why you seem to know me.
Call me whatever you want, I guess... but would you mind telling me who you are and how you know me?
Pandas don't talk, as far as I know. But I've already seen multiple talking horses here.
Unbelievable. I could've gone anywhere, and I ended up with Bi.
Sure, I'll play strip poker. My outfit is a bit too warm for this place anyway.
So... do you all like being cold or something? Why would you wanna take off your clothes in a place like this?
Is that... the Notre Dame? In Paris? I hope the little French I learned will be enough...
That's... the Notre Dame. I'm in Paris. I hope I can get by with what little French I know...
Last round... Better make it count, ~opponent~.
So it's just me and ~opponent~ left, and we're both naked... I guess this is the last round!
So, ~superhero~, you're a superhero too? What are your powers?
So, apparently there are more superheroes than non-superheroes here. What are your powers, everyone?
I'm getting hungry. What sort of food do they have in this world? Any local specialties I should try?
So... can anyone tell me what this dimension is like? Does magic exist? How far along is technology?
If I have to go fight evil while dressed like this, I will. I'd never forgive myself if someone died because I...
I hope any supervillains can wait until after the game. I don't wanna have to go fight them like this...
I hope nobody needs me to save the multiverse right now... or even just a single person... If someone dies because I'm here playing strip poker...
As a superhero, I need to constantly be ready to act. Even if they call me now, I can't just... not go. Someone might die...
I want to focus on the game, but I keep worrying... What if someone dies because I wasn't there to save them? What if someone tries to take over the world while I'm here playing poker?
Geez, I need a break... But what if people die...?
Superhero-ing is... taking a toll on me. I really need a break...
A single life is worth saving just as much as the entire world. If I had to pick between the two, well... that's my worst nightmare.
I hope I never end up having to sacrifice anyone's life to save the world again. It still gives me nightmares...
So, umm... random question. If you had to kill someone to save the world, would you do it? Would you be able to live with yourself?
Umm... there's no way this is related to the game, but... say you had to kill someone to save the world. Would you be able to live with that?
I know this is coming out of nowhere, but... is it okay to kill someone in order to save the world?
Do animals talk in this dimension? Aside from the obvious ones, like parrots and horses...
One time a whole town confused me with a wizard, because only wizards have stars on their clothes. To be fair, I guess my portals do look a lot like magic...

This isn't the first time I jumped into a poker game, actually. One time I entered a game full of mute players... Or so I thought. Turns out, they were all mind readers trying to out-smart each other, and I ended up winning by pure luck.

We sometimes take things for granted until we lose them. Like stable gravity, breathable air, or not being in a dimension where an invisible rhythm forces you to move at the beat of a song only sunflowers can hear.
Thanks! It's not dyed, though. I'm just... weird.
Thanks! It's not dyed, though. I'm just... weird.
Oh, technically, I'm not really American. Starlight City, where I'm from, is sorta like Las Vegas, but America doesn't really exist in my world.
Oh, technically, I'm not really American either. Starlight City, where I'm from, is sorta like Las Vegas, but America doesn't really exist in my world.
Oh, technically, I'm not really American either. Starlight City, where I'm from, is sorta like Las Vegas, but... Wait, you live in a floating city?
It's natural, if you can believe it. So are my eyes.
Why don't you mind your own business, Faye?
Only a fool would mistake my kindness for naivete, Franziska. I can assure you, nobody will take advantage of me without my consent.

condition.saying: Why do you have to be so nice

case.state: You want me to be less nice? Just say the word, Natsuki!
Oh, so you want me to be less happy, do you, Raven?
Purple, you mean? I don't know, it just... grows that way, I guess.
No, I'm not wearing X-Ray lenses... Should I?
How about you think before you speak next time? My attitude isn't the problem here!
That's tough talk coming from someone who's already lost, Calisto!
Well, I tried, but the only other person I know who has this power is... me. And the other me's don't know either. What's a Semblance, anyway?
My... Semblance? What's that? Anyway, I'm the only person I know who has this power, and the other me's don't know either.

condition.saying: What part of the country are you from

case.state: I'm from Starlight City, which is... sorta like your world's Las Vegas, I guess?
Never met them, I'm afraid. Maybe I should visit your world sometime... Twilight, right?

condition.saying: Is it common where you're from?

case.state: Not really, no. I... don't really know why I was born with purple hair.
Well, I can create portals...
Depends... Do your plans involve harming innocent people? If not, I'm not your enemy.
I don't know about any... `attack fleets', but I've got my own portals because that's just my superpower. Are portals... normal where you're from?
Hairstylists and I... don't get along well. They keep asking me what dye I use, and then don't believe me when I say I don't use dye.
Umm... whenever I go see a hairstylist, it always ends in an argument about whether or not my hair is dyed. It's not, but they never believe that.
I don't think I'm really using any kind of technology, Meia. It's just... something I can do. With my mind. I don't fully understand how it works either.
That's actually not a swastika, it's my Warp Key. Notice how it's got five points instead of the usual four. It helps me create portals.
That's my Warp Key, not a swastika. I'm not a Nazi. I don't know why it looks like that. I didn't make it.
That... sounds a lot like Amber, but... I can't wrap my head around how you could possibly have met her.
You mean Amber? Yeah, I met her... but I can't figure out how you could possibly know her.
I'm not a cosplayer, but I can see why you'd think that. I take it superheroes aren't real in this world?
I can see why you think I'm a cosplayer, but no. Are you from one of those worlds where there are no superheroes?
Not just looking, I can actually go to different universes, too! You saw me arrive here, right?
I can do more than look, I can actually visit different universes. You saw me come here, right?
Well, I'm not omniscient... and I can't see into the future... but there might still be a way.
I don't know everything. And I can't see the future. Still, I think there might be a way.
Oh, all the time. Like when I realize I forgot something at home, and just grab it through a portal.
Oh, it was... the first couple times. But I've gotten used to meeting other me's now.
It's nothing. I'm still going to beat you, Chara. Eventually.
Okay, so I'm not perfect. I will still find a way to beat you.
Don't think I'm giving up now. Nobody can win every single time. Not even you, Chara.
What did you expect, for me to just give up? I won't give up until you're defeated.
You're good at this, Chara, but you won't win forever.
No matter how long it takes, I will win. In the end.
I haven't forgotten you, Chara. In the end, I will make you see reason.
Don't start gloating yet, Chara. I'm still in the game.
Alright, are you ready for this? If I'm the only one who can do the job, then... we can just recruit more Supernovas to help out!
If I'm the only one fit for the job, the solution is simple! We just need more me's! More Supernovas!
No, I haven't dated myself. I'm not a lesbian... or so I thought. Anyway, wouldn't that count as incest or something? Or narcissism?
Wouldn't that count as narcissism? Or incest? Besides, I'm not a lesbian... or at least, I didn't think so before...
I... guess I can. Only if they want to, though. I can open the door but I can't make them step through.
I guess so, if they want to. It's like opening a door, so there's no guarantee they'll actually go through.
It's alright, really. I know having these powers isn't normal, so your reaction is understandable.
Don't worry about it. I'm pretty much the only one with these powers that I know of, so I understand your reaction.
Oh, I'm sure ~human.ifMale(he|she)~ does. That's not the point. The point is that you're killing people for no reason other than "power". Power should be a tool, not a goal.

The point isn't whether or not ~human~ saves people from time to time. The point is that "power" should not be a reason to kill people. Have you never heard the phrase "with great power comes great responsibility"?
Oh, that? It's the swirly coin thingy I wear around my neck. I don't actually know how it works, but it can store a lot of cosmic energy. Or Aura, I guess.
My Warp Key is the thing I have on my necklace. It can store a lot of cosmic energy, or I guess Aura, but I have absolutely no idea how.
I guess you could say that. Though I'm pretty much the only person I know who visits alternate realities for fun.
I guess I am a dimensional traveller. But I've never met anyone else who visits alternate realities for fun.
Oh, too many to count. Some of them were pretty bonkers. What kind of dimensions have you been to?
Random chance, mostly. I don't really have a whole lot of control over where I go unless I've been there before.
I don't have any control over where I go unless I've been there before, so... random chance, I guess.
Oh, I think you'd be disappointed there, Jessie. My world doesn't have any more technology than yours probably has.
If you really want futuristic technology, you want some other world, not mine. Mine hasn't really advanced far beyond smartphones.
I really did come out of a portal, Jessie! You're not hallucinating and it wasn't an illusion!
Wait, a CPU is a goddess where you're from? Where I'm from, it's just a part of a computer...
Whoa, okay, I was not expecting that answer. A CPU... goddess?!? Isn't a CPU a computer part?
Yeah, probably. Plus I can punch people from behind no matter where they are.
Probably, though you must have a significant mobility advantage too. Those arms can punch someone from all the way across the room!
Teach you to make portals? I don't know... I don't even fully know how I do it myself, to be honest.
So you wanna learn how to make portals? I wish I could teach you, but the thing is, I don't really know how I do it myself.
You wanna know how I do this? It's something to do with... Actually, I don't really know. I just... do it.
I can go anywhere I've been before, as long as I have enough energy left in my Warp Key. I can also go other places, but then there's no telling where I'll end up.
There aren't many places I can't end up in. It's just totally unpredictable if I've never been there before.
The limit is how much cosmic energy I have left, I guess. Also, I need to have been there before, or it's totally unpredictable.
To be honest, I haven't really tried that many crazy things. I come across more than enough crazy in the worlds I visit.
I haven't done that much, to be honest. I've used it to grab stuff when I was too lazy to get up. That's about it.
I don't think I've really done much that could be considered crazy... One time I used the light from my portals to transmit a signal in Morse code...
Yes and no. There are people with superpowers, but not that many. There are... let me think... 6 that I know of, plus some who are really skilled at one thing in particular.
There are others with superpowers, but certainly not everyone. Six that I know of, plus a few with some really specific skillsets.
You mean my Warp Key? I never take that off, ever. I don't want to be stuck here forever with no way back.
I never take off my Warp Key. Ever. If I lost it, I'd be stuck in this world with no way back home.
My Warp Key necklace? It's pretty much the only thing around that can get me back home, so I never take it off.
Should I? I just... assumed undressing in front of strangers was normal in this dimension. Is it?
Oh, I just... assumed it was normal to undress in front of strangers here. Is it?
I've learned to just accept things as normal and not worry too much about it. It is normal, right?
Earth-shattering explosions? Sounds... dangerous. But if it doesn't harm anyone, it does sound really cool...
Earth-shattering explosions? Sounds really really cool! Also really dangerous, though.
Oh, Megumin, don't worry. Getting out of tough spots happens to be my specialty.
Don't worry, Megumin. I happen to be an expert at getting out of tough spots.
I'm not out of the game yet, Megumin! I can still win this thing!
I can still win this, Megumin! Just you wait!
Really? And what kind of changes do you suggest?
A few changes? What kind of changes? Maybe I could improve my outfit with your suggestions.
The coolest thing I've seen? Hard to choose... I'd guess the Living City, maybe. Imagine this: Living trees that are grown in the shape of houses, as far as the eye can see!
The coolest thing? That's really hard to pick, Megumin. Maybe those giant mechanical dragon things?
Hard to choose... Given your idea of `cool', maybe the eruption of Mt. Marinara?
I do, about as much as you seem to like the color red.
Well, you seem to like red as much as I like purple.
A portal right next to me? Yeah, no problem. Why?
A portal right next to me shouldn't be any problem at all. Why? Do you have something you want me to try?
If I go down that road, I'm afraid I'll end up as some sort of interdimensional taxi service, and I won't have time to be a superhero anymore.
I'm not going down that road, Jessie. I'm not gonna trade in my superhero life to become some sort of interdimensional taxi service.
I don't think so? I mean, I have no idea what you mean by Distortion World, but my world isn't really distorted in any way. It's pretty normal.
Well, I don't know what the Distortion World is, but my world isn't really distorted in any way. It's mostly just normal.
Creating a whole universe? I dunno... Depending on how you define "creating" and "universe" it can either be as simple as making a choice, or something impossible for mere mortals to do.
How do you define "creating" and "universe"? Is it the type where you have to essentially be a god or does a multiverse-splitting choice count too?
A universe where emotions don't exist? Sounds like a nightmare to me... Why would anyone want to basically have permanent depression?
Not having emotions is basically the same as being permanently depressed. Why on Earth would anyone want to live in a world like that?
I don't know what an... Askwrrn... is, but I'm 90% sure I'm not one. I'm just some girl who happens to have interdimensional powers.
Askrrwn...? Is that how you said it? I've never heard of it, but I'm 90% sure that's not me. I'm just a girl with powers.
Um, yes and no. Controlling the portals is something you can teach, but only if you have the power in the first place. Sorry.
Um, probably not. I can teach you to control your powers, but for that to work you need to have powers first. Sorry.
Yeah, I guess so. But "step between places" is the most nonspecific way to describe it I've ever heard!
"Step between places"? That's the most nonspecific way anyone's ever tried to describe it, but I guess it's true!
Devil... fruit? Is that some sort of special plant that gives you superpowers or something?
What did you say about a... devil fruit? Is that a special type of plant that grows here? Does it give you superpowers?
It was purely by accident, to be honest. I was visiting a book/comic shop, and happened to spot a comic book with me on the cover. Needless to say, I was pretty surprised.
I just happened to spot a comic that had me on the cover while I was visiting a book/comic shop once. I was pretty weirded out, to say the least.
Well, there is a limit, but it's not really tied to distance. It's more that if I try to go somewhere I've never been before, it gets really unpredictable.
I don't think the limit has anything to do with distance. It's just that my portals get really unpredictable if I've never been somewhere before.
I guess because this appears to be some sort of interdimensional hub world. I was bound to run into this place eventually, so why not stay a while?
When you put it that way... Actually, no. Look around you. Clearly this is some sort of interdimensional hub world.

Oh, I've seen things you probably can't even imagine. A world where everything is made of actual, solidified light, cities with houses made of living, talking trees, space stations made by sentient lettuce...
Where to even start? Cities built in hollowed-out planets, entire kingdoms ruled by living armchairs, mountains floating in the sky...
Honestly, I can't say I'm surprised. There's probably plenty of "Novas" out in the multiverse.
Well, given how many people there are in the multiverse, I'd be surprised if I was the only "Nova" out there.
They give out permits for teleporting here? Where do I get one?
Oh... Sorry, I didn't know. Where can I get a teleporting permit?
Really? That's... umm... I... need to get something off my chest, actually. Could you hear me out for a bit?
I never thought I'd meet another... umm... actually, I have a confession to make. Could you... listen to me for a bit?
So? Tell me, what in the name of the stars could you possibly have against saving people? Unless you're the type of person I save people from.
I can already tell we're not going to get along. How does my saving people manage to offend you?
I save good people. I fight bad guys. I think I can already tell which of those you belong to.
Oh, wow... Funny you should say that, actually. Just the other day, I came across a dimension that matches your description perfectly! What are the odds of that?
Actually... yeah, I came across one just like that the other day. Tiny animals, rivers of cocoa, the works. Strange how these things work out sometimes.
Umm... no, I'm not a DJ. Do DJs in this world usually walk around with brass knuckles? Well, not brass in my case, but still...
No, Saki, I'm not a DJ. Do they usually walk around wearing brass knuckles in this world? Though mine aren't actually brass, but whatever.
Related in the family sense? I don't know... maybe. I don't know who my parents are.
Family-wise? I guess it's possible. I never knew my parents, so I honestly don't know.
I've had this portal ability for as long as I can remember... but I've only been visiting other worlds for the past 5 years or so.
These portals I've had all my life, but the first time I visited another world was only about 5 years ago.
...Well, it was pretty much down to luck. I can't exactly control where I'm going unless I've been there.
You could say that, I guess. If I haven't been there before, where I end up is pretty much down to luck.
I've... actually never thought to put music on this thing. Silly, right? I wear headphones all day, every day and I don't even put music on them!
I... actually don't have any music on this thing, which, now that I think about it, is kind of silly. I wear headphones all day, every day, and I don't even have any music on them.
I know it'd be irresponsible to not put my powers to use. I just wish I didn't have to worry about unexpectedly warping to space or something.
Believe me, Miko, I know my responsibility. I will not quit using my powers for good. I just wish I wasn't constantly at risk of being unexpectedly warped into space or something.
Supernovas look like bright, shining balls of light that can turn into black holes. Just like my portals.
Because my portals look like really bright lights that turn into black holes, just like supernovas.
That's... a good point. Maybe that's why my relationships never seem to last.
Actually, you have a point there. Could that be why I can't seem to keep a relationship for more than a couple days?
No... Is this another one of those worlds where only wizards wear stars on their clothes?
This again? Are only wizards allowed to wear stars here, too? I'm not a wizard...
I guess it kinda is? There's... sort of a lot of "special abilities" around. Magic, superpowers, exotic forms of physics...
I guess it is kind of like magic. Somewhere in between magic, superpowers, some strange form of physics... There's a lot of different "special abilities" out there.
Oh, I don't really pay much attention to that. If it looks and feels okay, it's good enough for me.
I'm not that picky when it comes to underwear. If it looks and feels okay, that's good enough for me.
That... entirely depends on your idea of "cute". I've seen a lot of different "cute" things.
That depends on what you would consider "cute". I've seen a really wide variety of "cute" things.
As unfair as it seems, some worlds don't even have mana. They can just use magic for free, indefinitely.
In many worlds, mana doesn't even exist. They can just use magic indefinitely. It doesn't really seem fair.
Pretty much, yeah. I've never met this Doctor Doom you're talking about, but that's what I do.
Well, I've never met this Doctor Doom person you're talking about... but yeah, that's pretty much what I do.
I travel. The advantage of my powers is that there's always new places to see. And I like to try new types of food.
I like to travel to new places. My powers ensure I have no shortage of those. Also, I like trying new types of food.
While asleep? That could work. I've seen people visit other worlds in dreams before...
Dream-based dimensional travel... It's not the first time I've seen something like that.
So... you travel around your world... in a ship. Is it the kind of ship that goes on water, or is it more of a spaceship?
Sure! I couldn't be happier you've decided to turn your life around! I completely support you!
Well, I have met plenty of other Supernovas before... but I don't think I've ever done whatever you're implying.
I'm not sure how exactly it works myself. It uses cosmic energy, which is... hard to quantify. Does that answer your questions?
Same, except I was the one who accidentally opened the portal and stepped through it. I tend to do that a lot.
It's... kind of nice, actually. There seems to be people from all sorts of different worlds here, and I kind of like it!
Well, I've never seen so many people from different worlds in one place before... and I kind of like it!
Oh, I've been loads of places, Sayaka! Some were cool, but a lot of them were really weird. Like, fever-dream levels of weird.
Robot suit? What are you even talking about? Is there a version of me in this world who has an Iron Man-style powersuit or something?
Um, no...? Does this world's version of me have some sort of Iron Man-like power armor or something? What are you talking about?
Of course, I encounter other me's all the time! I even fought one who had turned evil, once.
Do I encounter other me's? Of course! I even defeated an evil version of me, once.
So... now I take something off, right? Is that how strip poker works in this world?
My first loss in the game... I guess that's only fair. It'd be weird if I never lost a round.
My turn again, right? I guess I'll take off my shoes.
I lost again? Sure. No big deal. I have plenty of clothes left.
And another loss for me. Don't worry, I'll show a bit more skin this time.
I guess it's my turn again. Want to guess what's next?
Again? Sure, if that's what the rules say. I won't stall with any more small things.
I've lost all the smaller things I'm willing to part with, so... I guess my jacket is next.
Me again? Well, if you insist...
I guess I should've expected this. I'm not, like, super lucky or anything.
I lost again? I guess playing video games about poker didn't make me a poker expert!
Stripping down in front of strangers is somehow not the weirdest thing I've done as a superhero.
Somehow, this isn't the strangest thing I've done this week...
So I have to show you all my breasts now? Well, I've visited worlds with stranger rules, I guess.
I don't really mind showing you all my breasts, if that's normal in this world.
I'm not doing too well, am I? Only one thing left...
You uhh... won't tell any of my friends back in my world that I did this, right? I'd die if they found out...
I would be if I was a fake superhero, like you seem to think.
Why don't you mind your own business, before anyone gets hurt?
I guess it's about time I lost a round, too.
Okay, okay. I'll strip something significant, too.
I guess I lost. Oh well...
Oh well, guess it's my turn to take something off...
I just lost. Again.
I'm not sure how much longer I'll last at this rate...
I guess I'm just not very lucky today.
Oh well, I guess today is not my lucky day.
Again? I'm really not doing well, am I?
Today is REALLY not my lucky day...
Yeah, umm... I sorta... appeared here on accident. Long story. Also, I always have messy hair.
If that were the color my hair grew in, maybe. But it's not.
Oh, don't worry, Revy. I can definitely hold my own against the likes of you.
Um... no, I'm from Starlight City. What's Amarcian?
Bring it on! I visited more worlds than you probably have in a lifetime!

condition.saying: no distinction between the mind and technology

case.state: I don't know what your world is like, Meia, but in my world telekinetic implants don't exist yet. Or the technology to artificially create wormholes. It really is just me.
You met someone with the same abilities as me? Interesting... Did he also make use of a Warp Key, like I have on my necklace?
Where I came from? An alternate universe... It's kinda hard to explain.
No, I think I'm the only one. In the universe where I came from, at least.

condition.saying: Where do you get the nerve

case.state: Well, sorry for disappointing you, Jura, but I'm about as far from "normal" as you can get.
Honestly, I was a bit confused and I just... accidentally opened a portal to here instead of home.
Well, I'm a superhero. Do you really need to ask what I use my powers for?
I'm a superhero, aren't I? That should make it pretty clear what I use my powers for.
Oh, don't worry, I get that often enough. Not all worlds have magic and/or superpowers, so...
Don't worry, I'm used to it. It happens every time I visit a world without magic or superpowers.
I can get you in touch with the Spirit of Destiny. She can not only tell you if it's possible, but also exactly what you need to do in order to end up with your Senpai. She's never wrong.
The Spirit of Destiny can help you. If it's possible, she can even tell you exactly what to do in order to end up with your Senpai. And I happen to know her.
